title: Examples in user_guide
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I am playing around with the Iris dataset to learn how to use Ludwig. I want to use the confusion matrix visualization (as an example). It was not too clear from the user guide which arguments were necessary and which arguments were optional. I initially kept getting the following error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\sriki\Miniconda3\Scripts\ludwig-script.py", line 11, in <module>
    load_entry_point('ludwig==0.2.1', 'console_scripts', 'ludwig')()
  File "C:\Users\sriki\Miniconda3\lib\site-packages\ludwig-0.2.1-py3.7.egg\ludwig\cli.py", line 108, in main
  File "C:\Users\sriki\Miniconda3\lib\site-packages\ludwig-0.2.1-py3.7.egg\ludwig\cli.py", line 64, in __init__
  File "C:\Users\sriki\Miniconda3\lib\site-packages\ludwig-0.2.1-py3.7.egg\ludwig\cli.py", line 94, in visualize
  File "C:\Users\sriki\Miniconda3\lib\site-packages\ludwig-0.2.1-py3.7.egg\ludwig\visualize.py", line 3119, in cli
  File "C:\Users\sriki\Miniconda3\lib\site-packages\ludwig-0.2.1-py3.7.egg\ludwig\visualize.py", line 650, in confusion_matrix_cli        
  File "C:\Users\sriki\Miniconda3\lib\site-packages\ludwig-0.2.1-py3.7.egg\ludwig\utils\data_utils.py", line 76, in load_json
TypeError: expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not NoneType
```
but I have since figured out that I was not specifying the `ground_truth_metadata` option. The problems are:

1. The error message is not as informative as it can be.
2. It was not straightforward (at least for me) which of the files was the correct input to this option. I did eventually figure it was `test_set_metadata.json`. 

**Describe the use case**
The use case is a person reading the documentation and trying to use one of the visualizations. In my case it was confusion matrix, but it could be any of them.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I think a walkthrough starting with a simple dataset would be quite helpful for a newcomer. Under visualization in user guide, start with this simple dataset. Then under each of the visualizations, after describing the CLI arguments, provide an example of how to use it.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Informative error messages are one way to go. For example, instead of the error I received above, something like:

```
You have not specified the ground_truth_metada argument for the confusion_matrix visualization.
```

**Additional context**
Again, this is probably an issue that only newcomers face, and is perhaps not that important for others. I am willing to help out if you think this is worth addressing.
